p: Those were very dear letters, and we are grateful for them. It is fine to know of your success in the job. I expected it, but it's good to hear.
I couldn't plan, to go East now, altho' I feel sure, at last, that I am getting much better. Maybe later on it will seem the right thing to do.

Wimberly is working hard for me in Lincoln. Something may come of it. There are two other possibilities. I could hardly handle a job as I am just now, but that will work out reasonably soon, I hope & believe.
Would you care to try women's colleges, and, maybe, Harvard?
There's nothing to say, really just at present - except that we do love you and are heartened by your good letters.
Don't feel from this that I'm very blue. I'm just not altho' I could easily be.
With endless love for you & the precious young ladies - bless them!
